{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.02265v1", "title": "Constructions of and Bounds on the Toric Mosaic Number", "summary": "Knot mosaics were introduced by Kauffman and Lomonaco in the context of
quantum knots, but have since been studied for their own right. A classical
knot mosaic is formed on a square grid. In this work, we identify opposite
edges of the square to form mosaics on the surface of a torus. We provide two
algorithms for efficiently constructing toric mosaics of torus knots, providing
upper bounds for the toric mosaic number. Using these results and a computer
search, we provide a census of known toric mosaic numbers.", "main_category": "math.GT", "categories": "math.GT", "published": "2025-04-03T04:24:21Z"}
